page.title: 12DRESSING A WELL
page.content: Each year Hope Valley College designs and dresses its own well. There are six stages in dressing a well. The first is finding a suitable design which is often a biblical subject. The second stage is collecting and selecting the clay. For an average well about four dustbins full are needed. The third stage is puddling the clay. The clay is put into a large bath and water worked into it, with bare feet. It has to be exactly the right consistency. The fourth stage is emptying the clay into boxes shaped for the well. They should be three quarters full. The fifth stage is collecting the flowers which will form the design. Most of these come from local gardens. Finally the picture is made from the leaves of the flowers and other plants.
